cleaned_text: Vital Records The Office of Vital Statistics and Registry registers vital events and maintains the following vital records: - Birth records from 1923 to present - Marriage records from 1941 to present - Death records from 1941 to present - Domestic partnership records from 2004 - Civil union records from 2007 - Certificate of birth resulting in stillbirth from 1969 - Adoption records - foreign and domestic Women, Infants & Children (WIC) WIC is a public health nutrition program that provides wholesome food, nutrition education and community support for eligible women who are pregnant and post-partum with infants and children up to five years old. [PDF] [Vaccination Coverage in LTC Facilities](https://www.nj.gov/health/ltc/home/dashboard.shtml) In the News NJ Health Department Approves New Harm Reduction Center, Highlights Overdose Prevention Efforts on International Overdose Awareness Day As the state marks International Overdose Awareness Day on August 31, the New Jersey Department of Health (NJDOH) remains committed to ending the overdose crisis and has approved the state's first new harm reduction center (HRC) in five years. NJDOH also announced new funding for comprehensive harm reduction services throughout the state. New Jersey Department of Health Proposes to Readopt N.J.A.C. 8:42 Licensing Standards for Home Health Agencies, with Amendments, Repeals and New Rules The Division of Certificate of Need and Licensing within the Health Systems Branch of the New Jersey Department of Health (Department), with the approval of the Health Care Administration Board, proposes to readopt N.J.A.C. 8:42 Licensing Standards for Home Health Agencies, with amendments, repeals, and new rules. N.J.A.C. 8:42 establishes licensing standards for home health agencies, which provide preventive, rehabilitative, and therapeutic services to patients in their homes or residences. New Jersey Department of Health Honors National Breastfeeding Month In honor of National Breastfeeding Month, the New Jersey Department of Health (DOH) is highlighting the progress made in implementing the Statewide Breastfeeding Strategic Plan. National Breastfeeding Awareness Month shines a light on the important policy work being done across the country to accommodate lactating mothers and parents. To commemorate the month-long national recognition, Governor Murphy [proclaimed](/health/assets/documents/proclamations/BreastfeedingMonth2023.pdf) August 2023 Breastfeeding Month in New Jersey. New Jersey Department of Health Investigating Possible Cluster of Legionnaires' Disease Cases in Passaic County The New Jersey Department of Health (NJDOH) is investigating a possible cluster of Legionnaires' disease cases in residents of municipalities across Passaic County and Bergen County and is encouraging residents who develop symptoms suggestive of Legionnaires' disease to seek medical evaluation.
